cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles south-southwest of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: Dorian is accelerating northeastward, moving away from the Mid-Atlantic coast and toward Nova Scotia and the Gulf of St. Lawrence.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch remains for Fundy National Park to Shediac, Parson’s Pond to Triton, and Indian Harbour to Stone’s Cove, Canada.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning for eastern Nova Scotia (Hubbards to Avonport).  Tropical-storm warning for Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard, East of Bar Harbor to Eastport ME, Prince Edward Island, and southwestern Nova Scotia (Avonport to Hubbards).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer Mid-Atlantic waters, southeastern New England, coastal Maine, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, Gulf of St. Lawrence, and southwestern Newfoundland.
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands may bring brief gusts 20–30 mph Friday evening; tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<5 %).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge warnings for Chesapeake Bay were discontinued.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light, short-lived showers possible tonight; heavy rainfall not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Maryland coast on Friday.
